oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of students and faculty, a dancer, the Mexican president's family, a beauty contest winner, motorcyclists, military men, a gatekeeper, a tea room director, a car, a war reenactment, an operator, European royalty, a shop owner, and an airplane. Nashville Banner, 1927 June 19.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Calles, Natalia; Calles, Alicia; Hunt, Evelyn; Loving, William; De Armond, Mrs. Frank L.; Mdivani, Apolonie; Mdivani, Serge; Morris; Cummings, Edith Mae; Lindbergh, Charles A.
Nashville Banner
Group portraits; Students; Teachers; Presidents; Beauty contestants; Motorcycles; Military personnel; Automobiles; Women; Rulers; Airplanes; Air pilots; Business people; Telephone operators
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of Webb School students and faculty, a French dance student, the Mexican First Lady and her daughter in California, a beauty contest winner in California, English motorcyclists, military men in California, a London gatekeeper blowing a horn, a New York tea room director, a car decorated with a photo of Charles Lindbergh, a war reenactment at Harvard University, a switchboard operator in New York, European royalty, a Parisian shop owner holding a lion, and a group of people surrounding Lindbergh's plane in Paris. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Mason; Herbert
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:relation: Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
